Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2009 05:17AM Linda37 wrote: I wore a sports bra 24/7 throughout rads.  I am a 34 DD so I needed the support and the breast with the lumpectomy would hurt without the support.  My skin held up well and the bra didn't seem to bother it at all.  My advice would be to wear a bra if you want to.  It sounds like there are some good bra suggestions in the thread here.

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 03:41AM Linda37 wrote: Hi, Today I had #6 of 31 radiation treatments and I've been using calendula lotion. It's a little early for me to tell if it's working but my understanding is that the best way to care for your skin is to be proactive.  I use it 3 times per day. It seems to me that every woman is very different and what works for one doesn't necessarily work for another.  But all of the ladies that posted before me are recommending things that I've read a lot about and they all seem to be very helpful to people. Best wishes to you! Linda
